item.description:

item.title: At least 6 potholes of varying sizes along the middle of Westbourne Drive, 19th December
item.description:
A line of potholes roughly along the middle of Westbourne Drive, Cheltenham, mostly between Westbourne House and Queensholme. They are shedding large pieces of gravel onto the road, which is very dangerous, particularly for cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbourne Drive, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken sign being driven over, 19th December
item.description:
The keep left sign was broken and removed in the summer, and replaced with a temporary A board style sign. This sign was constantly driven into and is now broken. It is driven over on a regular basis by people cutting the corner. It can be seen from the photograph people are STILL cutting the corner, and still driving over the broken sign in its current location. The road cannot support vehicles where there is no road and itâ€™s just soft soil, and the noise of cars crashing over the sign is beginning to cause concern in the village.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whittington Court Lane, Whittington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 19th December
item.description:
Customer reported severely potholed road and pavements in area, needs inspecting
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 19th December
item.description:
One corner of the cover is sinking, tarmac has crumbled away. Not sudden but getting worse
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous trees, 19th December
item.description:
The trees on Coxs Way require some attention in my opinion. A number of the trees looked either diseased, being strangled by creeping ivy and some are now leaning. My fear is that during events of extremely high winds one or more trees could fall causing damage to residents cars or property or possible injury to pedestrians. These trees are quite high and could easily reach properties on both Coxs Way and Ellison Close. Again, in my opinion these trees should be professionally pollarded and/ or have the top 20/25 foot lopped off in order to avert the aforementioned instances occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellison Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple deep and wide potholes spanning the entirety of Parabola Lane - The whole road needs completely resurfacing, 19th December
item.description:
There are large, wide dangerous potholes spanning the entire length of Parabola Lane from the Bayshill Villas Lane entrance through to the Overton Road exit. This road is used regularly and can be quite busy at times. It is unsafe and needs reviewing. This road has been in need of repair for at least a year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parabola Lane, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Water logged crossing, 19th December
item.description:

item.title: Bin neees to be moved, 19th December
item.description:
Currently this bin has been positioned on an inclined grassy embankment which becomes very slippy when wet with dew in the summer and rain/ mud in the winter. I myself have slipped trying to use it several times. The bin needs repositioning to the path edge below asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poop bin needs to be moved, 19th December
item.description:
Currently this bin is positioned up a slight embankment which becomes muddy and slippy to reach when the weather is bad, it needs to be repositioned next to the path so you are not navigating slippy mud to use it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollis Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
